content.question: In context, the metaphor of the “petted imp” in the second paragraph suggests which of the following about the role that vanity plays in Mrs. Barnaby’s character?

choices.label: Although a minor aspect of her character, it suggests that her attitude is alternately playful and serious-minded.
Even though she knows that it impedes her ability to attain her goals, like a child she is unable to control her impulses.
While it is subordinate to her fundamental character traits, she indulges it as a means of achieving her aims.
Although she struggles to keep it in check, it is a predominant feature of her character and defines her as silly and foolish.

content.answer: While it is subordinate to her fundamental character traits, she indulges it as a means of achieving her aims.

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Identify and explain the function of a metaphor.
